author: Special Correspondent
text:
The Consumer Protection Council, Tamil Nadu, has urged the Union Railways Minister to sanction a new line between Bikshandarkovil and Namakkal so as to provide another route on Bengaluru-Tiruchi sector.

The new 79-km line could fetch good revenue as there was heavy demand for a new train between Bengaluru and Tiruchi.

At present, there is only one train daily that connects Tiruchi and Bengaluru — Mayiladudurai-Mysore Express – pointed out.

The travel time to Bangalore from Tiruchi would be reduced by about two-and-a-half hours if the new line was laid, said S. Pushpavanam, secretary of the council, in a representation to the Union Railway Minister.

He suggested the line could be operated on a build, operate, and transfer mode by the private sector.
title: Consumer body wants one more train to Bengaluru
